introduction.header: It won‚Äôt be a white wedding, but‚Ä¶
text: ‚Ä¶we‚Äôll be glad to see you there.
This isn‚Äôt the wedding we initially envisioned, but it is the one we‚Äôll cherish for the rest of our lives.

If you‚Äôre reading this, then you were selected from a handful of family and friends who mean the world to us. (No offense to those we couldn‚Äôt invite! We feel really bad!) This will be an intimate affair on a mountaintop in Round Prairie, OR, situated amongst the natural splendor of Oregon‚Äôs nature.

text: Nestled above the South Umpqua River, Stacey and Craig McLaughlin‚Äôs mountaintop provides panoramic views of the valley below. Stacey, a strategic leadership coach, opened her heart to Justin while he was a student worker at the local natural history museum, and they‚Äôve maintained a friendship ever since.
We asked Stacey to lead our ceremony, and look forward to her thoughtful words as she joins us in matrimony.
An Oregon-centric dinner, local drinks, and sparkling conversation will commence before and after the ceremony. We look forward to seeing you there.

text: Blocks of rooms are available from Seven Feathers Resort & Casino in Myrtle Creek, OR, which is approximately a 20-minute drive from the wedding and reception venue. Use the code ‚ÄúABCD‚Äù to book within our block of rooms. Those wishing to book elsewhere are welcome to do so, but please let us know so we can update the hotel.
Transportation to and from the hotel will be provided. Details to come.
This being Halloween weekend, the casino is putting on a Spooktacular. Feel free to participate in any of the offerings during your stay.

Travel to the Roseburg area can be accomplished via flights to Portland (PDX), Eugene (EUG), Medford (MFR), and Grantspass (GTP) airports. PDX will probably be the cheapest option and offer the best car rental options. Seven Feathers is around 3.25 hours south of Portland, 1.75 hours south of Eugene, 64 minutes from Medford, and 40 minutes from Grantspass. We know it‚Äôs annoying, but we love you. ü§é And just remember: There‚Äôs no sales tax in Oregon, and you don‚Äôt pump your own gas (and don‚Äôt need to tip the gas attendants!).

text: Following a well-rested night surrounded by slot machines, we hope you‚Äôll join us for a send-off brunch at TKTK RESTAURANT at 11 a.m. on us. We truly appreciate you all coming to our event and can‚Äôt wait to see your bushy-eyed faces.

text: The Pacific Northwest offers a trove of outdoor experiences to partake. The Umqpua Valley, where Roseburg is situated, is home to easy access to Craker Lake National Park, the Oregon coast, Duck central at the University of Oregon, microbreweries, and local vineyards. If you‚Äôll be staying in the area before or after the wedding, let us know, and we can offer some suggestions for activities you might look into. Apart from libations, Oregon is also known for Chinook salmon, dungeoness crab, hazelnuts, marionberries, and dairy.

Crater Lake National Park is located around 2 hours from Roseburg and is the deepest lake in the United States. This time of year, expect snowfall around the rim and beautiful views from any of the ample lookouts.

The Oregon Coast is around 1 hour from Roseburg. The closest towns are probably Coos Bay and Charleston, small fishing towns that offer a variety of taffy shops, cheese mongers, and crabbing. Further north is Florence, which has a larger town and sand dunes. And even further are Tillamook, known for its cheese and other dairy products, and Astoria, known for being the home of The Goonies and Kindergarten Cop.

The University of Oregon will be a good stop for anyone who enjoys collegiate sports, the Nike story, or summer Olympics. Featuring the world-famous Hayward Field — used for Olympic time trials — and the Oregon Ducks football stadium and basketball arena, the UO and surrounding Eugene offer a great college town experience with all that entails, along with finer dining and tax-free shopping.

Microbreweries are surprisingly plentiful throughout Oregon, and Roseburg is no exception. Notable locations include Backside Brewing Co., Two-Shy Brewing, North Forty Beer Company, and Salud Brewery. Most have food and a wide variety of beer types. If you‚Äôre not into beer, recommended coffee shops include Cascades Coffee House and My Coffee, and any of the Dutch Bros. coffee huts you‚Äôll no doubt have seen along the road (where they‚Äôll put a straw in a cup of hot coffee — just go with it).

Vineyards find a great home in the Umpqua Valley and, a bit more north, the more famous Willamette Valley. Local vineyards that offer tastings, tours, and more, include Abacela Winery, Reustle Prayer Rock Vineyard, Melrose Vineyards, and Henry Estate. If you‚Äôre into something a little different, there‚Äôs a mead shop called Oran Mor Mead we‚Äôve been meaning to check out.
